DataElement.preferredName: Thyroid Gland Dysfunction Patient Self-Report Personal Medical History Yes or No Response
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A highly vascular endocrine gland consisting of two lobes, one on either side of the trachea, joined by a narrow isthmus; it produces the thyroid hormones which are concerned in regulating the metabolic rate of the body. Disturbance, impairment or abnormality of function. Subjective reports made by the patient. An account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced. A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Thyroid Gland Dysfunction Patient Self-Report Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A highly vascular endocrine gland consisting of two lobes, one on either side of the trachea, joined by a narrow isthmus; it produces the thyroid hormones which are concerned in regulating the metabolic rate of the body. Disturbance, impairment or abnormality of function. Subjective reports made by the patient. An account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A highly vascular endocrine gland consisting of two lobes, one on either side of the trachea, joined by a narrow isthmus; it produces the thyroid hormones which are concerned in regulating the metabolic rate of the body.

Concepts.definition: An endocrine gland located at the base of the neck that produces and secretes thyroxine and other hormones. Thyroxine is important for metabolic control.

Property.preferredName: Dysfunction Patient Self-Report Personal Medical History
Property.preferredDefinition: Disturbance, impairment or abnormality of function.:Subjective reports made by the patient:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: Disturbance, impairment or abnormality of function.
Subjective reports made by a patient.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
